text: Combine the chocolate, butter and syrup in a pan over heat. Stir till you get a thick glossy chocolate mix with no lumps. Reserve 60ml of this mixture in a jug and put the jug aside. Crush the digestives in a freezer bag with a rolling pin. Leave some larger pieces to add extra crunch. Add the crushed biscuits to the non-reserved chocolate mix. Add the marshmallows too. Stir till you get a new thick crunchy mixture. Pour the mixture into a baking tin of whatever size, according to how thin or thick you want your rocky road to be. It is recommended that you use a small-medium square baking tin. Pour the reserved chocolate mix evenly across the rocky road.  Place in the fridge. Chill for at least 2 hours but preferably overnight, for best results. Cut into pieces. Once taken out of the fridge, cut into equal rectangular pieces. Serve on a plate for your friends and family. Be proud as they compliment you on your rocky roads and remember to save a big slice for yourself! These are best eaten for the first two days after making but can realistically still taste nice for about six.
